title.narrative: Food Security Program with Salesian Missions - Zambia - 2015

description.narrative: 2 shipments of food aid, shoes, clothing and sporting equipment

Salesian Missions is a network of 34,000 Catholic priests, brothers and sisters around the world who help children live better lives and build brighter futures. The Salesians of Don Bosco operate 5,000 schools and technical training centers, 23 colleges, 216 clinics and hospitals, 225 orphanages and shelters, and run a wide variety of social and economic development activities throughout the world. This shipment is being sent to the Salesians of Don Bosco in Zambia. The Salesians in Zambia respond to the needs of hundreds of children in crisis. More than 20,000 households in the country are headed by children whose parents have died because of the HIV/AIDS epidemic. These children are desperate for adult support as well as the basics that all children need. Salesian programs give these children a chance to go to school, opening a new world of possibilities for them. Programs that will receive meals include City of Hope, an elementary school, high school and home for girls in Lusaka; rural schools; shelters; youth centers and community centers.
